headline.main: PLANES HARRY FOE; Germans Forced to Give Ground in Hills South of Medjez-el-Bab ROMMEL STILL RETREATS Eighth Army's Artillery and Aircraft Pound Mareth Line -- Penetrations Reported BRITISH CHECK FOE IN NORTH TUNISIA

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, Feb. 28 -- Hardhitting British veterans checked German attacks along the entire northern front in Tunisia and launched a counter-attack today in the Medjez-el-Bab area, where the enemy was making a bold bid to cut off the battered town that is the gateway to Tunis.
abstract: Brit counter-attack Gers, Medjez-el-Bab area; Gers lose ground in hills south of Medjez; Montgomery forces attack Rommel troops south of Mareth Line; Rommel continues retreat; Allied aircraft and Brit 8th Army artillery pound Mareth Line; Ger attacks slowed down, Bou Arada and Djebel Mansour areas

byline.original: By DREW MIDDLETONWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
